title: Error HH411: The library @openzeppelin/contracts@3.4.1, is not installed. Try installing it using npm.

body:
Don't include the version here:

```
import "@openzeppelin/contracts@3.4.1/access/AccessControl.sol"
```

It should be:

```
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol"
```

Please use [our Discord server](https://hardhat.org/discord) if you have more questions like this.

@fvictorio I'm compiling with Solidity 0.6.12 and that means I need the 3.x version of OpenZeppelin contracts.
That's why I need to specify the specific version.
Remix works with this type of import.

Why don't update to later Solidity version? Interacting with Uniswap V2 contracts sometimes demands Solidity <0.8.0 since they introduce a breaking change to how Solidity handles conversion.

@raisehero I'm not sure what to add. This is the way hardhat works, the resolution of installed libraries follows what node does, and you just don't include the version of package in the import :man_shrugging: Just remove it and it should work.

Now if you mean that you want to use two different versions of the same library, that's a different thing.

But that's exactly how even NPM installs specific version of a package, packagename@version.
https://www.whitesourcesoftware.com/free-developer-tools/blog/npm-install-specific-version/
